column4: Hello, I have an HP Pavillion dv6233se and the latest version of ubuntu 11.10. I can't seem to get my wireless card working. I've tried quite a few things from the forums with no luck. can anyone help?
do you know the card?
The website says it's an 802.11b/g wlan
this command will tell you exactly.  lspci | grep -i wireless
the command returns nothing, even with sudo
copy and paste it it works.
unless the card is not being read.
i think that may be the case. I copied and pasted with ctrl + shift +v
any other way I could find out what kind of card it is?
that isolates the card lspci part of that command would show other hardware as well, I see problems on the web with that card just stopping working, as it before?
has*
anyway hard to say for me without a card name/type,maybe others will have an idea.

yeah, it worked fine on windows, and on a few older releases of ubuntu. I also got it to work with one of the forum methods, but it stopped working after restart and I haven't been able to replicate the results. I think I've done too many things.
does broadcom sound familiar, with alll that tweaking you ddidn't isolate the actual card?
yes, broadcom does sound familiar. I wish the HP website gave me some more specific info than just 802.11b/g WLAN
!broadcom | ramadan
try looking at tyhe wiki.
the*
I've tried that. any chance I could have done too many tweaks and they're all fighting each other... if that makes sense?
I would not really know I have not had to mess with those cards if that is what you have,  would post on the ubuntu forums as well and include as much info as possible.
thank you for your help and patience
no problem.
